newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian soybean prices firm up on demand.
newsitem.headline: Indian soybean prices firm up on demand.

text.p: Soybean prices were firm on Monday on good demand from processing plants, dealers said.
Prices were up by 100 rupees per tonne in plant delivered condition in brisk trade, they said.
Arrivals were around 6,000 tonnes in central Indian markets, they added.
Soyoil solvent fell by 100 rupees on limited demand from refineries and processing plants while soyoil refined moved up by 100 rupees per tonne on good demand, dealers said.

Soymeal and rapeseed extraction prices were slightly up on limited supplies from processing plants. Soymeal yellow was $272 per tonne in export and rape seed extraction, $135 per tonne in export. Rape seed extraction was 4,600 rupees FOR Bedibundar and 4,550 rupees to 4,575 rupees FOR Bhavnager.
